conclusion: To determine which container (E, F, G, or H) the liquid from each spout (A, B, C, D) will flow into, we need to trace the path of each liquid as it passes through the baffles.
The green baffle is positioned below spout A and directs liquid to the left.
The green liquid from spout A flows into container E.
The green baffle is positioned below spout B and directs liquid to the left.
The yellow liquid from spout B flows into container F.
The brown baffle is positioned below spout C and directs liquid to the right.
The orange liquid from spout C flows into container G.
The brown baffle is positioned below spout D and directs liquid to the right.
The pink liquid from spout D flows into container H.
Final Answer: Liquid from A flows into E, liquid from B flows into F, liquid from C flows into G, and liquid from D flows into H.
